list: Anchor splits and grips for a strong hold; an audible click will indicate when the anchor is secure
Great for hanging pictures and mirrors
No pre-drilling necessary; installs easily with a #2 Phillips screw driver
Package contains 4 plastic anchors and 4 #8 1-1/4-in" Pan-head Phillips screws

reviews.title: "Great new product"
reviews.text: It is an easy to use product and as effective as most other drywall anchors, but user must be sure not to over tightening the screw because it may tear the drywall. This is specially true when you are anchoring in very old drywall.I took the anchor off, added some glue in the hole and the anchor and then re-installed the anchor. Waited till next day and then used it to hold a very heavy bass ship's helm to the wall.First anchor I used was tightened too much and the anchor started to tear the drywall and pushing out because the strap used to hang an item was not long enough to fit flush with the wall
reviews.author: plert

reviews.title: "No tool chest should be without these"
reviews.text: I've used ordinary wall anchors for years, but since I've been using these, I'm convinced they are the best for their intended use. The only time I've had them fail is when I've tried to use a larger screw than the one included. There was a time I actually had the anchor strip out inside the drywall and that's not an easy thing to make happen, yet, I managed to do it. I would suggest using the screws included or at least find the equivalent diameter screw in whatever application you need. I realize there are times you need larger circumference coverage and might have to use a washer, etc. to account for certain circumstances.
reviews.author: tommyboy0124

reviews.title: "Best hollow wall anchor around"
reviews.text: Have used this style wall anchor before. This anchor is design to drill its own hole into drywall without the use of a drill bit.Because this anchor threads itself into drywall, it can be easily removed by reversing the direction of the thread when removal is required.
reviews.author: Arizona-Joe

reviews.title: "disappointed in quality"
reviews.text: I have used these many times before but for some reason when I used these this time, I had several of them that actual snapped off before they were completely seated all the way in. Once they snap off, your done. No way to grab it to remove the broken off half still in the wall.
reviews.author: handymanfrombham

reviews.title: "A Different approach to Drywall Anchors"
reviews.text: Actually, I wpuld rate more on the order opf 4.5 stars, but am taken with the approach.  Unlike trtaditional plastic drywall anchors, that are pushed into a pre-drilled hole and expand on use with a suitable screw, EZ-Ancors actually screw into the drywall themselves, creating their own grip in the substrate, they also feature an external face, which [prtevent them from being susceptible from pushing through the wall.  Manufacturer indicates that no prior drilling is needed, but I would recommend driling at least an 1/8" pilot hole to assist in locating the anchor, as well as easing the initial cutting into the surface.  actually, I have used a 3/16" to further facilitate penetration of my rather hard, 60-year-old walls.  One precaution, I first saw these in a video whereby they were driven into the wall using a phillips bit in a power drill.  It can be done, but set adjustable torque rather low, as the head of the anchor strips out rather easily.  Another limiting factor is that the head of the anchor is 0.5 inch in diameter, which one must consider both in terms of space to install, and whether will be revealed by a narrow fixture.  And lastly, despite what the video indicated, I would use the supplied screws, OR if using washer-head cabinet screws, use one size larger than #8 th video depicted.  The #8's do not seem to fully expand the anchor, reducting their fnuctional untily, in my opinion.
reviews.author: MikeS

reviews.title: "Worked Great!"
reviews.text: I had a heavy shelf to hang in my laundry room. These were very easy to use and hold quite well. The shelf is very secure and sturdy. The way the anchor just zips right into the wall like a screw is ingenious!
reviews.author: Becki

reviews.title: "Easiest anchors..."
reviews.text: Next to the metal versions, these are arguably the best drywall anchors to come along in many years. Their ability to hold in drywall compared to the typical hammer-in type is unmatched, along with their ease of use. These simply do what they're supposed to do and do it with panache.
reviews.author: Frankonwheels

reviews.title: "They can break easily when installing it seems."
reviews.text: Used to hang a large mirror in the bathroom.First one went installed fine.Second one while screwing in the anchor snapped.Not sure if it was defective or just bad luck.Word of warning, even if you start to install these perfectly level to each other, as it screws in it can shift.This means they may not be perfectly level with each other and the mirror had a slight tilt.It was barely noticeable to the eye. To fix it I backed out the screw a little which caused one side of the mirror to shift down a little.
reviews.author: m3rdpwr

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: rkelly

reviews.title: "Great Drywall Anchors"
reviews.text: These drywall anchors and screws are reasonably priced and work with a 75-pound load. I've used them to hang sound bars, dry erase boards and pictures. The heaviest thing I have used these for is a shadow box. They are easy to install and take a minute at most.
reviews.author: JimmyD

reviews.title: "Works as advertised"
reviews.text: Went right in, seems to grab well, I did use a cordless drill because it was handy but I didn't need to, could have done it all by hand.
reviews.author: Maysville

reviews.title: "Best drywall anchor yet."
reviews.text: Really easy to install. Holds really well. If you want to remove it, just unscrew it. Great product!
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "I discovered that we have hard walls..."
reviews.text: I bought these to hang a jewelry box for my wife. They worked but not without a few extra vocabulary words added to my list. First, these are plastic anchors. Second, we have a hard layer (Plaster, I think.) spread over the drywall in our house. It was this thin hard layer that gave us problems using the plastic anchors as they began to melt trying to get them worked into the wallboard.They did work, but I think I will opt for the metal anchors next time.
reviews.author: Brian

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: rkelly

reviews.title: "Bad Ancors"
reviews.text: Unable to screw into wall. Destroys wall in the process.
reviews.author: Fred

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: DProperty

reviews.title: "Best wall anchors ever"
reviews.text: Hammer in, screw in, no fuss. These are the easiest and best wall anchors I have ever used in drywall. No drilling mess, no fuss. Just tap the spiky part in, screw in the anchor till it's flush, screw in the screw and done. Holds a lot and just feels more secure than the ones that are supposed to expand. Easier to remove, too, if needed, just unscrew it from the wall. Great product.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Sell these by themselves"
reviews.text: This product is great, I use them a lot for mounting things to sheetrock, I have never had one come apart or out of the wall. The only downside to the way Lowe's sells these anchors is they don't offer just the anchors. You have to buy the screws along with the anchors, for most of what I do, I don't need the screws, and usually end up needing more anchors...
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Work great time and time again!"
reviews.text: I have used these in various houses and my office.  I most recently used them to mount 40lb studio monitors and they perform like a champ.  In my office I have hung large whiteboards and bookshelves.  When I first used them I was skeptical because they feel small compared to those larger wall anchors, but these work great.
reviews.author: JesseC

reviews.title: "Poor quality"
reviews.text: Purchased these EZancor wall hangers (75 lbs max weight) to use in 1/2 inch drywall. Back of the box confirmed that it could be used in this manner, though it listed 1/2 inch as the maximum. Initial attempted use was as directed on the package......anchor broke at the tip. Second attempt was after I pre-drilled a hole the same dimension as the anchor drilling tip.....2nd anchor wouldn't screw into the sheet rock, and it also shattered on the attempt to screw it in. Got a third anchor and it functioned normal in the 1/2 inch sheetrock. Needed to install a second anchor and also had to pre-drill the hole in the sheetrock. Again....trouble getting the anchor to screw into the sheetrock but it finally grabbed and anchored itself. When the screws were installed, the anchors appeared to function as advertised, but I am not happy with the final results. Limited the weight on the anchors due to some minor damage to the second anchor on installation. I won't buy this product again.
reviews.author: Stan

reviews.title: "Too Easy"
reviews.text: I used these ez anchors and it was just like it said easy.  I used it to hang shelves and the shelves are up and holding all of the weight that I have placed on them. I highly recommend this product to anyone wanting to anchor something to the wall where you can't reach your 2x4s in the wall.
reviews.author: Steven

reviews.title: "Great for simple drywall"
reviews.text: Great on traditional drywall. Do not use on drywall that's been hung over plaster laths. Anchor will hit the lath halfway in and then stop screwing in. Results are some nice hole in the drywall that need patching and an anchor that won't work.
reviews.author: Mflennik

reviews.title: "Got job done"
reviews.text: I was hanging some double curtain brackets up with the anchors that came with it, and when put rod with curtain up on the brackets, it just pulled out. I then I went and got the hefty ones, to make sure that it didn't repeat. It did great!
reviews.author: Rockie

reviews.title: "Drywall Anchors"
reviews.text: I use these anchors any time I have to hang something - no matter if the item is 1 lb or 25.  They have never failed.  I feel a little more secure knowing that I am not doing too much damage to my wall and that these anchors will hold.
reviews.author: Missi

reviews.title: "Drywall anchors"
reviews.text: The product worked as it should. It seems strong, for being mounted in wall board, and should work unless we happen to knock it off. At that point I will mount a board on the studs and then mount the towel rack to that.
reviews.author: DasHurts

reviews.title: "E-Z Anchor"
reviews.text: I love how this product works.  It outperforms competitive anchors, which are hard to start into the drywall.  These go in, you hear the locking click, screw it in until tight and you are ready to hang or fasten.
reviews.author: Quentin

reviews.title: "Anchor worked correctly!"
reviews.text: I have had to use many drywall anchors over the years and this is the first one I can honestly say worked correctly on the first try. I will for sure buy these anchors again on my next hanging project.
reviews.author: BigRed52

reviews.title: "I love these things."
reviews.text: Quick and easy to use. Just be careful not to overtighten when installing the anchor. If it turns out you have tried to drill the anchor into a stud then you can just screw the screw into the stud.
reviews.author: Barry

reviews.title: "1 or 5"
reviews.text: This is one of those products that is either a 1 or a 5. I don't know how you'd get a 4...that being said these anchors should be able to handle most if not all hanging projects around the house.
reviews.author: Brandon

reviews.title: "Nice Mollies"
reviews.text: These work much, much better than the standard mollies you can get. I wrestled with them to hang a shelf then gave up and went to Lowes. The hardware guy suggested these and they worked great.
reviews.author: TonyC2639

reviews.title: "Strong Screws"
reviews.text: I might need stronger products but they've worked for me, the only screw that worked for me give me that smooth look without having any problems hanging anything with them up to this point.
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "Easy"
reviews.text: Easy to figure out how to insert into wall. Can't beay the strength once you put the metal screw in. Much better than any other drywall hanging solution for ease of use and strength.
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "Excellent Product and Very Easy to Use"
reviews.text: Extremely happy that I found this product to use for outdoor decoration this year.  Very easy to setup the timer feature.  Works as expected.  Excellent product for the price also.
reviews.author: Sonya

reviews.title: "Great Product"
reviews.text: I am a repeat, repeat customer of these handy little drywall anchors. . . and when I run low, I'll go back for more. Easy to use, secure and removable if I change my mind later.
reviews.author: Richard

reviews.title: "drywall anchor"
reviews.text: excellent product, especially for those of us who are not great with a drill and regular anchor.  Hold my heavy curtain rods up well and are easy to install.  Highly recommend.
reviews.author: ness

reviews.title: "Half way there"
reviews.text: This product is very useful if you get a pack of anchors that is well made. Half of my box cracked when I attempted to install em in drywall. Luckily we bought the $2 box.....
reviews.author: stevilpromotions

reviews.text: I am a general contractor and use these often. For hanging towel bars and shower rods. They work great and if I hit a stud with it I back it out and use just the screw.
reviews.author: Ronbo

reviews.title: "Says it all"
reviews.text: Product was so easy to use, my own mother at age 70 , I showed her how to use them, and now she is using them for wall pictures and everything else on the walls.
reviews.author: Jonathan

reviews.title: "These worked great in my walls"
reviews.text: I've had an issue with crappy drywall  so ha gong anything off the wall has been an issue .    These fixes that issue    They dog in and hold on well .
reviews.author: Jamesd

reviews.title: "Sheetrock anchors"
reviews.text: Used the product and like the performance, self tapping and hold very well. With the point tip you can locate the anchor exactly where desired.John
reviews.author: Jp

reviews.title: "Beginner friendly"
reviews.text: Easy to use. Did want purchase anymore plastic anchors because they never stay in my drywall. But these work great and very secure in the drywall.
reviews.author: Shay

reviews.title: "Excellent description."
reviews.text: I made shelves in bathroom. Used anchors to float my supports without stud connections. Results - excellent strength and easy installation.
reviews.author: Kent

reviews.title: "E-Z Ancor 50 Pack"
reviews.text: The product is easy to use and extremely effective.  Installing the ancors allows you to support objects directly in to the dry wall.
reviews.author: Teeder

reviews.title: "Wall anchors"
reviews.text: I use this type anchor on all light weight wall hangings (on drywall).  I keep a bunch of these on hand.  Best such anchor for DW.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "The Best"
reviews.text: I have used these for years. They are by far the easiest to use and hold more weight that the standard plastic dry wall anchors.
reviews.author: Tiz

reviews.title: "Best ever"
reviews.text: This system is the best for hanging anything from drywall, holds up to 75 lbs. with no effort and is the easiest to install.
reviews.author: Skip

reviews.title: "Works well until it doesn't."
reviews.text: Worked great and easy to use. I had to start the holes though as the sheetrock was a little too dense for the self screwing.
reviews.author: Nathan

reviews.title: "I use these allot"
reviews.text: I've never have had any of these tear out. I do handy man work and replace allot of defective traditional wall anchors.
reviews.author: The-Handyman

reviews.text: This is the best anchor for drywall. The only brand I'll use. I move frequently so I've already bout about 4 packs.
reviews.author: Wes

reviews.title: "Best no stud fix ever!"
reviews.text: Best 30 second fix for anything around the house! From toilet paper holder to clocks....cheap, strong, easy!
reviews.author: Mtbke1

reviews.title: "Best anchors"
reviews.text: I would not use any other anchor. Slightly bigger hole, but confidence that your items will not fall off
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.text: Great product! Clear instructions and no need to pre-drill, much stronger than the hammer in anchors.
reviews.author: Toby

reviews.title: "These work great!"
reviews.text: We used these to put our closet shelves up and they are sturdy & do the job they're supposed to do.
reviews.author: Dyonne

reviews.title: "Anchors"
reviews.text: I purchased these to mount overhead lighting in my kitchen. They are high quality and strong.
reviews.author: Gus

reviews.title: "Love Molly's"
reviews.text: A friend recommended these to me to hang my Flat Screen...I love how easy there are to use.
reviews.author: hilmarid

reviews.title: "Drywall anchor"
reviews.text: These anchors make it super easy to hang shelves where you don't have studs to screw into
reviews.author: Cmo1702

reviews.title: "Good Quality Product"
reviews.text: Does the job. Used it to hold heavy mirror and worked fine. Love that they screw in.
reviews.author: lbrinson

reviews.title: "great product works"
reviews.text: works like a champ much better then the old anchors holds in the wall much stronger
reviews.author: tom

reviews.title: "Just like described"
reviews.text: Just some standard drywall anchor with screws included, priced right, good quality.
reviews.author: unicorn

reviews.title: "Love Them!"
reviews.text: Love the way they hide flush against the wall. Makes mounting things much easier.
reviews.author: EnginnerJim

reviews.title: "Easy and strong"
reviews.text: These anchors are very easy to install and they are very stabil and strong.
reviews.author: RHCharlie

reviews.title: "Sting anchora"
reviews.text: These anchors work very well and install just as the instructions detailed.
reviews.author: Sonny

reviews.title: "The best drywall anchors"
reviews.text: These are very easy to use (self drilling) and have great holding power.
reviews.author: kenneth

reviews.title: "They Work"
reviews.text: They do the job they were designed to do. Nothing more needs to be said.
reviews.author: Cason

reviews.title: "Makes hanging items easier"
reviews.text: I love these. They make hanging items easier and keeps them in place.
reviews.author: Angel

reviews.title: "Fast, Simple, Holds Tight"
reviews.text: I love these anchors. They hold tight and are very easy to install.
reviews.author: Kryptospore

reviews.title: "Strong and sturdy"
reviews.text: Great for holding up heavy items but some were dull and rounded.
reviews.author: Mp

reviews.title: "great no drill dry wall anchor"
reviews.text: Easy to use, heavy duty and no predrilling needed.

questions.question: "The anchor takes WHAT SIZE screw? #8? #10? etc."
questions.author: NFJ1

answers.author: Ronbo
answers.text: This fastener takes a number eight screw with sheet metal threads. Any length over an 1-1/4 should work.

answers.author: Cason
answers.text: Use the screws that come in the package, if you have lost them try a 11/4" # 8 if it seams too large or too hard going in use a # 6

answers.author: Handy
answers.text: There are at least two sizes of anchors and they both take different size screws. Don't worry, the screws are included!

answers.author: Jenn
answers.text: The right size screws are included and these anchors (and included screws) come in different sizes.

questions.question: "Once installed, is there a way to safely remove these anchors from walls if need be? Thank you."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Paslode
answers.text: When removing screw-in anchors from drywall, one easy option is to countersink the head of the anchor slightly beneath the drywall surface by turning a few extra times. This will serve as a spackle surface to speed up the patching process. The other way is to continue driving the anchor through the wall and patching, if the anchor is unable to be backed out with a screw driver.

questions.question: "Can I buy it by the bulk"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Paslode
answers.text: The largest pack size available is 50/pack.

questions.question: "Can one of these hold a 40-lb mirror?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Paslode
answers.text: Yes, one of these anchors will be enough to hold a 40 lbs. mirror.

questions.question: "Each one of these anchors holds 75 lbs? So if I have four anchors it should hold 300 lbs?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Paslode
answers.text: The 75 lbs. weight rating is a shear load rating for hanging items flush to the wall such as a mirror. This rating is per job, whether you use one or multiple anchors. Using additional anchors does not multiple the weight that can be supported.

answers.author: Paslode
answers.text: Thank you for your question. The E-Z Ancor and the screw are both 1-5/8 inches in length. All the anchors and screws in the package are the same size. The maximum weight capacity for using this anchor to hang an item in 1/2 inch drywall is 75 lbs. for items hung flush to the wall. The weight capacity may be less for items hung out from the wall, like shelving. The condition of the drywall can also affect the weight capacity. This anchor should NOT be used for ceiling applications or for hanging a television. If you have any additional questions about using E-Z Ancor for your fastening project, please feel free to contact tech support at 800-848-5611 from 8:30 - 5:00 CT Monday - Friday.

questions.question: "What is the weight capacity for the EZ 71537 anchors."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Paslode
answers.text: Thank you for your question. E-Z Ancor Twist-N-Lock 75 lb. Medium Duty Drywall Anchors will hold a maximum project load of 75 lbs. in 1/2 in. drywall. The 75 lb. weight capacity is for items hung flush to the wall and may be less for items hung out from wall, like shelving. Please contact tech support if you have additional questions or any concerns about your fastening application. They are available at 800-848-5611 from 8:30 - 5:00 CT Monday - Friday.
